Author: dynamicsystem
Text: Emotions are involved in every decision we make. There’s no such thing as non-emotional eating. If you’re hungry, you feel a negative emotion, like irritability. Then you eat to make yourself not hungry, which will make you feel a positive emotion, happiness/satisfaction.

Author: prettyTownSpinster
Text: Hi. I hope I can help. I suffer from what I would call emotional eating but at times  I can emotionally eat relatively healthy foods like cucumbers (I’ll literally slice up five cucumbers and eat them all), rice cakes (I’ll eat four packages of them) until I’m so stuffed I’m scared my stomach will split. I usually attribute it to my mind set where I feel completely out of control and just like this eff it attitude
